aviodrome-lelystad.name: Aviodrome Lelystad
aviodrome-lelystad.description: Discover the fascinating world of aviation in this unique museum.
aviodrome-lelystad.heroDescription: Experience a journey through aviation history. From the first flight attempts to modern aircraft.
aviodrome-lelystad.fullDescription: Aviodrome Lelystad is the national aviation museum of the Netherlands, featuring over 100 aircraft, interactive exhibitions and stories from Dutch aviation history.
aviodrome-lelystad.whyVisit: We drop you off directly at the entrance. No parking stress or public transport hassle.

items.title: One-way
items.description: From home, hotel or station to Aviodrome Lelystad.

items.title: Round trip
items.description: Outbound and return in one booking.

items.title: Families & groups
items.description: Spacious vehicles and child seats available.

faq.question: What does a taxi from Amsterdam to Aviodrome cost?
faq.answer: A taxi from Amsterdam Central to Aviodrome costs approximately €85 for a sedan and €110 for a minivan. You always receive a fixed price in advance.

faq.question: Can I be dropped off directly at the entrance?
faq.answer: Yes, our driver drops you off directly at the main entrance of the Aviodrome, so you can go straight inside.

faq.question: Is a return trip to Aviodrome possible?
faq.answer: Absolutely! You can indicate when booking when you want to be picked up again. Ideal after a day at the aviation museum.

faq.question: How long does the journey to Aviodrome take?
faq.answer: From Amsterdam the travel time is approximately 45-55 minutes, depending on traffic.

kaasmarkt.name: Alkmaar Cheese Market
kaasmarkt.description: Traditional cheese market experience in the heart of the Netherlands.
kaasmarkt.heroDescription: See the famous cheese carriers in action at the historic Waagplein.
kaasmarkt.fullDescription: The Alkmaar Cheese Market is a living piece of Dutch history, held every Friday from April to September.
kaasmarkt.whyVisit: We drop you off right at the square. No parking, no walking.

items.title: One-way
items.description: Early and stress-free arrival in Alkmaar.

faq.question: When is the Alkmaar Cheese Market held?
faq.answer: The cheese market takes place every Friday from April to September, from 10:00 to 13:00. With a taxi you arrive on time without stress.

faq.question: Where exactly does the taxi drop me off?
faq.answer: We drop you off directly at the Waagplein, right where the cheese market takes place. No long walking required.

faq.question: What does a taxi to the Cheese Market cost?
faq.answer: From Amsterdam approximately €65-75 for a sedan. From Schiphol approximately €55-65. Fixed price, no surprises.

faq.question: Can I book a return trip after the market?
faq.answer: Yes, we recommend booking a return trip around 13:30-14:00, so you have time to explore both the market and the city center.

fashion-outlets.name: Fashion Outlets
fashion-outlets.description: Premium shopping experience at the best fashion outlets.
fashion-outlets.heroDescription: Shop top brands with major discounts at Batavia Stad.
fashion-outlets.fullDescription: More than 150 premium brands in a comfortable outlet village.
fashion-outlets.whyVisit: We pick you up with all your bags. No carrying, no hassle.

faq.question: Is there enough space for all my shopping bags?
faq.answer: Yes! Our minivans and sedans have plenty of trunk space. We can even provide an extra vehicle if you're shopping with a large group.

faq.question: What does a taxi to Batavia Stad Fashion Outlet cost?
faq.answer: From Amsterdam approximately €75-85, from Schiphol €45-55. Ideal for a shopping day without parking costs.

faq.question: How long should I plan for a shopping day?
faq.answer: Most visitors spend 3-5 hours. Book your return trip flexibly so you can shop at your own pace.

faq.question: Can the driver wait while I shop?
faq.answer: For waiting times longer than 30 minutes, we recommend booking a return trip instead. This is more economical and flexible.

zaanse-schans.name: Zaanse Schans
zaanse-schans.fullDescription: Working windmills, crafts and historic houses in a picturesque setting.
zaanse-schans.whyVisit: Explore at your own pace without train schedules.

faq.question: How far is Zaanse Schans from Amsterdam?
faq.answer: Only about 20 minutes by taxi from Amsterdam. Much faster and more comfortable than public transport with transfers.

faq.question: Where does the taxi drop me off at Zaanse Schans?
faq.answer: We drop you off at the main entrance of the museum area. From there you can immediately start exploring the windmills.

faq.question: Is Zaanse Schans suitable for young children?
faq.answer: Absolutely! We have child seats available and the open-air museum is very child-friendly. A perfect family outing.

faq.question: What does a taxi to Zaanse Schans cost?
faq.answer: From Amsterdam Central approximately €40-50 for a sedan. Fixed price, so no surprises.

zuid-holland-tour.name: South Holland Tour
zuid-holland-tour.heroDescription: From The Hague to Rotterdam and Delft.
zuid-holland-tour.fullDescription: A full day of culture, history and modern architecture.
zuid-holland-tour.whyVisit: All highlights in one day without transfers.

faq.question: How long does the South Holland Tour take?
faq.answer: A full tour takes approximately 6-8 hours, depending on how long you want to stay at each location. Completely flexible to your wishes.

faq.question: Which cities do we visit during the tour?
faq.answer: Standard: The Hague (Madurodam), Rotterdam (architecture), and Delft (historic center). We can adjust the route to your preferences.

faq.question: What does a full-day taxi tour cost?
faq.answer: Approximately €350-450 for a full day including waiting time. For groups this is often cheaper than individual tickets and train travel.

faq.question: Can we adjust the route ourselves?
faq.answer: Yes! Discuss your wishes with us and we'll create a custom route. Want to add Scheveningen or skip a city? No problem.

volendam-edam-marken.name: Volendam, Edam & Marken
volendam-edam-marken.description: Three iconic villages in one tour.
volendam-edam-marken.fullDescription: Discover three unique villages, each with its own character.
volendam-edam-marken.whyVisit: All combined without public transport hassle.

faq.question: How long do I need for all three villages?
faq.answer: Plan 4-6 hours for a relaxed visit to Volendam, Edam and Marken. Our driver takes you past all highlights.

faq.question: In what order do we visit the villages?
faq.answer: Usually Volendam → Marken (with ferry) → Edam. We can adjust the route to your preferences and opening hours.

faq.question: Is the ferry to Marken included?
faq.answer: The ferry ticket is not included in the taxi price, but we drop you off at the harbor and pick you up on the other side.

faq.question: What does a tour of these villages cost?
faq.answer: From Amsterdam approximately €180-220 for a half-day tour. Much more comfortable than organizing public transport yourself.

giethoorn.name: Giethoorn
giethoorn.fullDescription: Cruise through canals lined with thatched-roof houses.
giethoorn.whyVisit: Relaxed travel to a remote destination.

faq.question: How far is Giethoorn from Amsterdam?
faq.answer: Approximately 1.5 hours by taxi. A comfortable journey without transfers, much more relaxing than by public transport.

faq.question: What does a taxi to Giethoorn cost?
faq.answer: From Amsterdam approximately €180-220 one way, €320-380 return. Ideal for a day trip with the family.

faq.question: Can we take a boat ride in Giethoorn?
faq.answer: Yes! We drop you off at the boat rental. You can rent a whisper boat or electric boat to explore the canals yourself.

faq.question: How long should we stay in Giethoorn?
faq.answer: Most visitors spend 3-5 hours. Enough time for a boat ride, lunch, and exploring the village. Book a return trip flexibly.

belgium-tour.name: Belgium Tour
belgium-tour.fullDescription: From Brussels to chocolate and historic landmarks.

faq.question: Do I need a passport for Belgium?
faq.answer: Within the EU a valid ID card is sufficient. Our drivers are experienced with international journeys.

faq.question: How long does the journey to Brussels take?
faq.answer: From Amsterdam approximately 2-2.5 hours. From Rotterdam approximately 1.5-2 hours. Comfortable and without transfers.

faq.question: What does a taxi to Belgium cost?
faq.answer: To Brussels approximately €280-350 one way. For a full day tour (including waiting time) approximately €550-700.

faq.question: Can we visit multiple cities in Belgium?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Brussels, Bruges, Antwerp or Ghent - we create a custom route to your wishes.

amsterdam-city-tour.name: Amsterdam City Tour
amsterdam-city-tour.fullDescription: Explore Amsterdam without navigation or parking stress.
amsterdam-city-tour.whyVisit: We handle the route, you enjoy the city.

faq.question: What do we see during an Amsterdam city tour?
faq.answer: Standard: Canal Ring, Dam Square, Museum Quarter, Jordaan. We can adjust the route to your interests and pace.

faq.question: How long does a city tour take?
faq.answer: A complete tour takes approximately 3-4 hours. Want to visit museums? Then plan a full day with waiting time.

faq.question: Can we stop for photos?
faq.answer: Of course! Our driver knows the best photo spots and is happy to stop so you can take beautiful pictures.

faq.question: What does an Amsterdam city tour cost?
faq.answer: From €120-150 for a 3-hour tour. Ideal for tourists who want to see Amsterdam comfortably without navigation stress.

keukenhof.name: Keukenhof
keukenhof.description: The world's most beautiful flower garden.
keukenhof.fullDescription: Open only a few weeks each year during spring.
keukenhof.whyVisit: Arrive early and avoid parking chaos.

faq.question: When is Keukenhof open?
faq.answer: Keukenhof is open from mid-March to mid-May. Book your taxi in advance, especially during peak bloom (mid-April).

faq.question: Why take a taxi to Keukenhof?
faq.answer: Avoid the busy parking lots and long walks. We drop you off at the entrance and pick you up when you're ready.

faq.question: What does a taxi to Keukenhof cost?
faq.answer: From Amsterdam approximately €60-75, from Schiphol only €35-45. Much more comfortable than crowded buses.

faq.question: How long should we stay at Keukenhof?
faq.answer: Most visitors spend 2-4 hours. Book a return trip flexibly so you can enjoy the flowers at your own pace.

efteling.name: Efteling
efteling.description: Magical theme park for all ages.
efteling.fullDescription: One of Europe's most beloved theme parks.
efteling.whyVisit: Relax on the way home after a long day.

faq.question: How far is Efteling from Amsterdam?
faq.answer: Approximately 1.5 hours by taxi. Perfect for a day trip, and the children can sleep on the way back.

faq.question: Do you have child seats available?
faq.answer: Yes! We have child seats in all sizes. Indicate the ages of your children when booking.

faq.question: What does a taxi to Efteling cost?
faq.answer: From Amsterdam approximately €180-220 one way, €320-380 return. Ideal for families who want to travel stress-free.

faq.question: Can we be picked up at a specific time?
faq.answer: Yes, you decide when you want to be picked up. Most families leave around 6-7 PM after a full day in the park.

walibi.name: Walibi Holland
walibi.fullDescription: Extreme roller coasters and water park.
walibi.whyVisit: No tired driving after an intense day.

faq.question: How far is Walibi Holland from Amsterdam?
faq.answer: Approximately 45 minutes by taxi. Much faster and more comfortable than public transport with multiple transfers.

faq.question: Is a taxi suitable for large groups?
faq.answer: Yes! We have minivans for up to 8 people. For larger groups we can provide multiple vehicles.

faq.question: What does a taxi to Walibi cost?
faq.answer: From Amsterdam approximately €100-120 one way, €180-220 return. Perfect for a group day out.

faq.question: Can we leave later after Halloween Fright Nights?
faq.answer: Of course! During Halloween Fright Nights (October) Walibi is open until 11 PM. We'll pick you up whenever you want.
